Grouped_Utterances: They’ve been a bit of a rollercoaster, to be honest. Well, I tried the open-ended questions with my son, and it worked a little. He opened up about some school stress, but he still shuts down at times. I felt relieved that he talked to me, but also worried about how much pressure he’s under. We talked about taking breaks and finding time for fun, but I think he still feels overwhelmed. I’ve been going to the beach more often, and it’s been great. I even started journaling about my feelings. It’s been really cathartic. I didn’t realize how much I had bottled up. Mostly just worries about the future and my kids. I also write about my dreams and goals. I want to explore more about pursuing a career in counseling. I think it could be a good fit for me.
Definitely! I feel more supported and less isolated.

Yes! I formed a small study group, and it’s been really helpful. I like the different perspectives they bring. It helps me understand things better. Just a little bit of scheduling conflicts, but we’re working it out. I think I can manage it. I just need to be proactive about it.
I’ve considered looking into volunteer opportunities or internships to get some experience. Yes, I think I could do that. I’ll make a list of places to check out.
